sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you have <radical>fingers</radical> it's <radical>easy</radical> to <kanji>hoist</kanji> things above your head. If you don't have fingers, well, it's not so easy.
meaningInfo: Hoist the sails! Hoist the anchor! Hoist a baby! All of these situations are easier if you have a ton of working fingers. (The more the better.)
readingMnemonic: Today, you have to <kanji>hoist</kanji> so much stuff. "<reading>Ah</reading>!" you say, "So much hoisting to do." Better get to it!
readingInfo: Imagine hoisting things over and over again. Each time you spot a new thing that needs hoisting, you say "Ah! Something else to hoist!"
